definition: name of a peak by the Three Gorges 長江三峽|长江三峡[Chang2 Jiang1 San1 xia2]
(of a mountain) high and tapered peak or summit/mountain-like in appearance/highest level/classifier for camels

sentences.english: The most marvelous scene here is the twelve mountains peaks and, in particular, Goddess mountain peak.
sentences.chinese: 景色最妙要数巫山十二峰，而犹以神女峰独具神韵。

definition: Wuxia Gorge on the Changjiang or Yangtze, the middle of the Three Gorges 三峽|三峡[San1 Xia2]
"heavenly lake", lake situated on a mountain/used as the name of numerous lakes, such as 長白山天池|长白山天池[Chang2 bai2 shan1 Tian1 chi2]
Mt Emei in Sichuan, one of the Four Sacred Mountains and Bodhimanda of Samantabhadra 普賢|普贤
Mt Wu on the Changjiang River (Yangtze) by the Three Gorges
Wushan county in Wanzhou suburbs of north Chongqing municipality, formerly in Sichuan
The Goddess, 1934 silent film about a Shanghai prostitute, directed by 吳永剛|吴永刚[Wu2 Yong3 gang1]
Jade Emperor Peak on Mt Tai in Shandong
Three Gorges or Yangtze Gorges, namely: Qutang Gorge 瞿塘峽|瞿塘峡[Qu2 tang2 Xia2], Wuxia Gorge 巫峽|巫峡[Wu1 Xia2] and Xiling Gorge 西陵峽|西陵峡[Xi1 ling2 Xia2]
the Jade lake on Mount Kunlun, residence of Xi Wangmu 西王母
